title: How do I install/update/trust a new ZOOM certificate with Error code 10006?
content:
Zoom.us renewed their DigiCert Global G2 TLS RSA SHA256 2020 CA1 certificate on 03/31/2023 and I now get a persistent error message (Error Code 6: ... certificate is not trusted.

Since then Zoom has not worked for me and their Artificial Intelligence says to open my browser and check my internet connection, time settings, updates, reinstall everything etc. - the usual responses ...

Zoom responds with "Error code: 6" and/or "Error code: 100068000" 

 but do not stipulate whether these are Zoom Error codes or certificate error codes.

The Artificial Intelligence insinuation is that FireFox is not trusting this certificate.

Is this something FireFox can help me with? Perhaps, how to make this certificate "trusted"?

Thanks, I hope, Dave Henry (Dan is my Facebook pseudonym) ( DavidJHenry@telus.net )

title: Color-Theme-Picker
content:
Hi Firefox Community, i wanted to ask wether the color-theme-picker from the 2022/23 winter season could be implemented for permanent use.

When the picker went out of service after the final day of the winter event, i was stuck with my favourite color. But i still want to try the other colors.

Now i discovered the colors in the firefox addon store as seperated themes. But i liked the color picker more than having to install and activate/deactivate the theme i want to try. Also the now seperated themes are sextupled because of their variants each being seperate themes now.

Additionally i discovered that the download icon now is black regardless the chosen color-theme. When i click it, it changes to white. On my other machine i had chosen the same color, but i didn't changed it since the winter event. There the download icon is originally (for example) purple when the download finished. So the color themes in the store are also not as complete, as the winter event colors.

Also the color picker was language located. Now i have to chose manually between dark and light and also the three subvariants and the language is only English.

Long story short: Can the color picker from the winter event be implemented permanently?

Greetings ffproblems
creator: ffproblems

title: To the designers of the Firefox pages
content:
Dear Peoples, 

   For the last 5 or more upgrades of your product, you have left your users with downgrades. The ability to read the fixed fonts on the tabs etc. is impossible. Not only for myself but for others also.   Suggestion, back in the day, when adjusting fonts, there would be a sample web page that was interactive with a scroll bar of number settings for each font location of that page. From Menu bar, tabs, headings, body etc. Example: if I wanted to Change the font size in my tab, I would point to tab and then roll to the number settings it would allow, Something like 1 - 10 or 1 -20.  Pls keep in mind, that you also have a lot of Senior Citizens that like to play in the sand box and our eye sight could use all the help you can give. I really enjoy Firefox and i don't want to jump ship but if my eyes keep hurting like this, it's not worth it. Thank you for listening and all the great work you do. 
                                                                                                           Cee Cee.....

title: bookmarks overwritten or erased ??
content:
Recently, my laptop got messed up and I've had to use a loaner provided my university. Initially I had no issue with transferring my bookmarks, as I just logged in to Firefox. However, the damn thing wipes everything whenever you log off or turn it off, and it decided to restart on its own when I left it alone for five minutes. So I was trying to recover my tabs, even though I knew it was unlikely to work, and one of the options for History said I could restore something with eleven items (I assumed it meant tabs, that sounded about right) and it warned me it would overwrite the bookmarks. I assumed that it meant the bookmarks I had at the time, which were the same bookmarks I've always had, so I said yes. But I guess it meant the default ones because the others hadn't loaded yet or something??? Because a bunch of random default tabs popped back up (not even eleven of them???) and the bookmarks are now solidly on just the default "Getting Started" and so on. I checked, it's the right account, it says my bookmarks are synced, there are no other files to restore from, and I don't get my actual laptop back for another week or two, so I can't check or restore from there. Are my bookmarks gone forever, or is there a chance I could recover them.... but only in a few weeks when I get my original laptop back (assuming THEY didn't wipe it again)? Or did it overwrite them for my profile in general, meaning it's synced and all my bookmarks are gone forever? Is there a way to restore them now, from the loaner laptop? I am in constant agony.

EDIT: Weirdly, I can still see my original bookmarks on my phone, which is promising--but I can't export a backup file from there, apparently, unless I want to import every single one one by one by sharing each one individually, which, no thank you. And I'm not sure if it's synced and am too scared to try. What's that one meme with Michael from the Good Place? "Birth is a curse and existence is a prison"? That's about how I'm feeling right now. It's 3 am.

EDIT 2: Fiddled around with it. Somehow fixed it. No fucking idea how. Sorry this was a pointless waste of cyber space. Wait, no, nevermind. I got OLD bookmarks back???? Like a few years old?????? What???????? I give up. This is better than nothing.
creator: tmbabe13

title: Helvetica font renders blank after updating to 112 via snap store
content:
After running `snap refresh firefox`, many sites I use no longer render any text.

There's a fix for CVE-2023-29537 in this release that affects font initialization - possibly related?
